subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Bandwagon Effect: Popularity as Proof
description: A quick win: understand The Bandwagon Effect: Popularity as Proof.

hook.text: A restaurant with a long line looks better than an empty one â€“ even if the food is identical.

buildup.text: The bandwagon effect: we adopt beliefs or behaviors because many other people do. Popularity becomes evidence.

discovery.text: Asch's conformity experiments: people gave obviously wrong answers just because everyone else in the room did.

twist.text: Social media turned this into an industry. Follower counts, likes, and trending tags are all bandwagon triggers.

climax.text: The bandwagon effect is rational in some contexts â€“ crowds aggregate information.

punchline.text: A million people can be wrong. They often are.

quiz.question: What did Asch's conformity experiments show?
options: People gave wrong answers to conform with the group
